about.title: About MaxIOFS
about.descriptionText: MaxIOFS is a high-performance S3-compatible object storage system built with Go and React. Designed to be simple, portable, and deployable as a single binary with an embedded modern web interface. Features full multi-tenancy support, BadgerDB-powered metadata storage, and comprehensive S3 API compatibility with 40+ operations including bulk operations, object lock, and advanced bucket management.
about.mainDeveloperDescription: Project entirely developed by Aluisco Ricardo. MaxIOFS was born as a solution to provide enterprise-grade S3-compatible object storage in a simple and efficient way, with complete multi-tenant support, high-performance metadata storage using BadgerDB, and production-ready security features.
about.featureS3CompatibleDesc: Full S3 API implementation with 40+ operations including multipart uploads, presigned URLs, and bulk operations (up to 1000 objects)
about.featureMultiTenantDesc: Complete tenant isolation with configurable quotas, cascading deletes, deletion validation, and global admin cross-tenant visibility
about.featureSecurityDesc: AES-256-CTR encryption at rest, JWT + 2FA authentication, AWS Signature v2/v4, comprehensive audit logging (20+ event types), compliance-ready (GDPR, SOC 2, HIPAA, ISO 27001)
about.featurePerformanceDesc: BadgerDB v4 metadata store with transaction retry logic, metadata-first deletion, and stress-tested with 7000+ objects using MinIO Warp
about.featureSingleBinaryDesc: Packaged as a single executable with embedded Next.js frontend, no external dependencies, and easy deployment
about.featureModernUIDesc: React 19 + TypeScript interface with dark mode support, real-time metrics, responsive design, and comprehensive management features
about.featureAdvancedS3Desc: Object Lock (WORM), Bucket Versioning, Bucket Policies (JSON), CORS, Lifecycle rules, Object Tagging, and Object ACLs
about.featureBulkOperationsDesc: DeleteObjects API (up to 1000 objects), sequential processing to avoid conflicts, complete metadata consistency
about.featureDualStorageDesc: BadgerDB v4 for high-performance object metadata, SQLite for authentication & audit logs, filesystem for object storage with atomic operations
about.featureRealtimePushDesc: Server-Sent Events deliver instant security notifications to admin users. When accounts are locked due to failed login attempts, admins receive real-time alerts in the topbar bell icon with read/unread tracking. Notifications persist across page reloads and respect tenant isolation (global admins see all, tenant admins see only their tenant).
about.featureDynamicSecurityDesc: Adjust security thresholds without server restart via Settings page. Configure IP-based rate limiting (default 5 attempts/minute), account lockout threshold (default 5 failed attempts), and lockout duration (default 15 minutes). Separate controls allow different limits for IP rate limiting vs account lockout, crucial for users behind proxies.
about.featureGlobalBucketsTitle: Global Bucket Uniqueness - AWS S3 Compatible
about.featureGlobalBucketsDesc: Bucket names are now globally unique across all tenants, matching AWS S3 behavior. This prevents bucket name conflicts between different tenants and significantly improves compatibility with standard S3 clients and tools. The change is fully backward compatible with no data migration required.
about.featureS3UrlsDesc: Presigned URLs and Share URLs now use standard S3 format without tenant-id prefix. URLs follow the pattern /bucket/object instead of /tenant-id/bucket/object, providing better compatibility with S3 clients, CDNs, and external tools. Automatic tenant resolution happens transparently in the backend.
about.featureBucketNotificationsDesc: AWS S3-compatible event notification system with webhook support. Configure HTTP webhooks for object events: ObjectCreated, ObjectRemoved, and ObjectRestored. Features include retry mechanism (3 attempts), prefix/suffix filtering, custom HTTP headers, and a user-friendly Web Console interface for rule management.
about.featureAutoTenantDesc: Backend automatically resolves bucket ownership from bucket name using new GetBucketByName() function. This enables presigned URLs to work without tenant context and maintains multi-tenant isolation while using standard S3 URL formats. All S3 operations remain transparent to clients.
about.featureBugFixesDesc: Fixed rate limiter double-counting (was blocking at 3 instead of 5 attempts), failed attempts counter not resetting after lockout, security page not showing locked users, SSE callback execution, frontend token detection, and presigned URL modal state persistence. All fixes improve system stability and user experience.
about.developedWithPassion: Developed with passion by Aluisco Ricardo

createBucket.title: Create New Bucket
createBucket.subtitle: Configure all advanced options for your new S3 bucket
createBucket.bucketNameHelp: Only lowercase letters, numbers, dots (.) and hyphens (-). Must be globally unique.
createBucket.makePublicHelp: Public buckets allow anonymous access. Not recommended for sensitive data.
createBucket.versioningHelp: Keeps multiple versions of each object. Required for Object Lock.
createBucket.objectLockTitle: Object Lock & WORM (Write Once Read Many)
createBucket.objectLockWarning1: Once enabled, it CANNOT BE DISABLED
createBucket.objectLockWarning2: Objects cannot be deleted until their retention period expires
createBucket.objectLockWarning3: COMPLIANCE mode: Not even the root user can delete objects
createBucket.objectLockWarning4: GOVERNANCE mode: Only users with special permissions can bypass
createBucket.complianceModeDesc: Maximum protection. No one can delete or modify objects, not even the root user. Ideal for legal and regulatory requirements (SEC, FINRA, HIPAA).
createBucket.governanceModeDesc: Flexible protection. Users with special permissions can bypass retention. Useful for testing and scenarios where flexibility is needed.
createBucket.retentionHelp: Specify at least one. Objects cannot be deleted during this period.
createBucket.complianceWarning: ⚠️ COMPLIANCE mode selected: This bucket will be IMMUTABLE. Objects cannot be deleted under any circumstances until retention expires.
createBucket.expirationHelp: Objects are permanently deleted after N days (0 = no expiration)
createBucket.serverEncryptionHelp: Encryption is not enabled on the server. To enable encryption, configure encryption_key in config.yaml and restart the server.
createBucket.encryptionInfo: AES-256-CTR Encryption - All objects in this bucket will be encrypted at rest using streaming AES-256-CTR encryption
createBucket.noEncryptionInfo: Objects in this bucket will be stored unencrypted. You can enable encryption later if needed.
createBucket.accessControlInfo: It is recommended to block all public access unless you specifically need to share data.
createBucket.validationNameInvalid: Invalid bucket name. Must contain only lowercase letters, numbers, dots and hyphens
createBucket.validationVersioningRequired: Object Lock requires versioning to be enabled
createBucket.validationRetentionModeRequired: You must select a retention mode for Object Lock
createBucket.validationRetentionPeriodRequired: You must specify at least days or years of retention
createBucket.confirmObjectLockWarning: This bucket will be IMMUTABLE and cannot be deleted until retention expires
